info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:29PM EDT until July 02 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN MECKLENBURG COUNTY... At 328 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Staunton River State Park to near Buffalo Springs to 7 miles south of Virgilina, moving east to southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Clarksville around 340 PM EDT. Boydton around 355 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Nelson, Richardson, Beechwood, Keats, Buffalo Junction, John H Kerr Dam, Finchley, Eppes Fork, John H Kerr Reservoir and Skipwith. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
